intro: Geraniospermum nivenii, commonly known as the Niven's geranium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, hairy leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
